intro: Psychotria muscosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage, which gives it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green. Psychotria muscosa is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and undergrowth.
